title: Application Management Tool
content:
Application Management Tool#Enabled by Commure OS
Include App Builder and User Manager.
This shows the application list in our new CommureOS platform The initial view shows a list of the applications that have been created on the Commure OS platform.
Creating an App#Login to the Application Management Tool. Click the + CREATE button in the top-right corner of the screen. Complete the following details in the drawer that opens on the right side of the screen and then click Save. Name Display Name Type Path Now you have a the shell of your application with a default set of database tables. You can make a number of updates to an app after it has been created, such as defining its database schema, setting business rules, editing basic info, and adding and removing dependancies.
Managing App Metadata Schema#What is the purpose of the metadata schema? What comes out of the box? What else can you do?
Each application is created with a default set of database tables, including Patient, Table2, created with a Patient table with some default nondescript tables
View app database schema#Select the app you want to edit in the application list. Click the Data Schema button. From here you can: Create a new table Create new table fields or edit existing fields Edit existing fields Preview app Preview app#Open the database schema for the app (see View an app’s database schema). Click the PREVIEW button to open a preview of the app. Create a new table#Open the database schema for the app (see View an app’s database schema). Click the Create button in the top-right corner of the screen. Complete the following details in the drawer that opens on the right side of the screen and then click Save. Select Table or Canonical Enter a Name for this table. For canonical tables, this will be a drop-down with the list of canonical tables available. For non-canonical tables, this will be a text input. Enter a Description for this table Create or edit table fields#For exitsing tables in your app’s database schema, you can add and edit fields.
Open the database schema for the app (see View an app’s database schema). Select the table in the list that you want to edit. In the bottom-half of the screen, select the Fields tab and then select the field you want to edit or click the + CREATE button to create a new field. Complete the following details and then click the Save button. Select the field Type Field - options include: base64Binary, boolean, date, datetime, float, integer, json, money, numeric, serial, string, text, time, uuid. Reference - A reference field stores a reference to a field on another table. For non-canonical tables the field type must be uuid. For canonical tables (FHIR) it must be string. Computed - To add the calculation logic, the user can write a javascript. Choice - Enter the field Name Select the Field Type Edit table information#Open the database schema for the app (see View an app’s database schema). Select the table in the list that you want to edit. Click the EDIT button in the top-right corner of the screen to launch the drawer to edit the table information. Edit the table Name, Is Canonical, or Description, and then click SAVE. Defining Table-Level Rules#Exploring GraphQL auto-generated APIs#Configuring UI Components#Return Home

title: Application UI Screen
content:
Application UI Screen Tool#The App UI screen is where you can create, edit, and delete UI pages.
Managing the Apps List#Describe Pages List
Viewing the Page List for an App#Select Applications from the sidebar. Select the app you want to edit. Click the APP UI button near the top of the screen. This opens the Page List showing each Page Name, Path, and Page icon for each page that has been created for the app. From the page, you can Preview the app, Create a new page, and Edit a page in the app. Viewing the Compoments on an App Page#Open the App UI page for the app you want to edit (for details, see Viewing Page List for an App. Select the Page you want to view. Select the Components tab and then click the componenent you want to view. The Component detail page displays, including all of the properties you can control. Editable properties are displayed with an Edit icon next to the Property Name. Sorting#To sort a column, click the column heading.
Filtering#Click the FILTERS button. (Add xref to Filtering topic?)
What is a page?#A page is a unique display used for different purposes, such as changing the view depending on the device (web, mobile, tablet) or creating different views for different audiences, such as managers and staff.
A page is made up components and is managed by rules.
Technically, a page is a component that gets mounted when a subpath matches the Page subpath configuration at the Appâ€™s Page Routing Engine.
An app can have multiple pages, but one page can only be part of one app (as it might depend on its context). A page can render multiple Components, and one Component can be rendered by multiple Pages.
What are components?#Components are presentational or data-wired UI Components/elements/functions. Components render design elements on the page to create the overall functuinality and display. A Page typically made up of an assembly of components.
Adding a Page#Open the App UI page for the app you want to edit (for details, see Viewing Page List for an App. Click the + CREATE button in the top-right corner of the screen. In the drawer that opens on the right side of the screen, enter the follow details and then click SAVE. Name- enter a name for the page Path- this is generated from the name and is not editable Page Icon- select an icon Editing Page Information#Open the App UI page for the app you want to edit (for details, see Viewing Page List for an App. Select the page you want to edit. Click the EDIT button near the top-right corner of the screen. In the drawer that opens on the right, edit page information and then click SAVE. Editing Page Components#Open the App UI page for the app you want to edit (for details, see Viewing Page List for an App. Select the page you want to edit. Select the Components tab and then click the componenent you want to edit. The Component detail page displays, including all of the properties you can control. You can: Edit component information (click EDIT) Edit component properties - editable properties are displayed with an Edit icon next to the Property Name. Adding Page Components#Open the App UI page for the app you want to edit (for details, see Viewing Page List for an App.
Select the page you want to edit.
Select the Components tab and then click the ADD button.
In the drawer that opens on the right, complete the following details and then click SAVE.
Type- Dropdown with the list of available componentes Display Name- not editable Parent- Dropdown with the list of previously added components Description Previewing a Page#Return Home
